Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2011 12:44PM missey29 wrote: Hi everyone - It's been 3 days since by 3rd of 4 rounds of TC. Just fatigue and depression this go round. They gave me a benedryl drip this time and I swear I've slept for 2 days. Been taking effexor 37.5 mg off and on for years since my dad's death in '03. Had hysterectomy 2 years ago and didn't know they were suppossed to help out with hotflashes. hadn't worked for me. oh well. That is a SE I can handle. my Onc said i would have about 5 weeks of radiation about 3 weeks after final TC treatment, Oct. 27. So, I should start Rads week of Nov. 17. The end is near. Yippee!!!!

Anyone with any advice about how to deal please let me know. I am seriously going to hurl, cry, or maybe both if I have to get stuck again. I know I am half way done with chemo, YIPPEE! Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2011 08:31PM missey29 wrote: vtEllen - Just had my chemo today. It goes down like this: day before treatment 5 tablets of dex in the AM and the PM, 2 tablets of dex in the AM the day of chemo. Chemo - Taxotere first, slow drip, found out that I get short of breath during a faster drip. Then the Cytoxen and then 10 minutes of saline. When home then a few different pills for nausea. Taylor777 - I'm doing the big chop tomorrow and I am rocking my two wigs. They are just fine for now. My last chemo is 10/27. I wear a scarf at home. Wishing all a free S/E day!!! ;)
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2011 09:40PM missey29 wrote: Thanks ladies. I'm painting my nails tonite. Also, much better emotionally after taking my Lorazipam and effexor. On another note, I had a full hysterectomy 2 years ago due to fibroid tumors and was put on hormone replacement drug, estradiol. Has anyone else taken this drug? I really do think it caused my breast cancer. I never once had issues with my birth control pills and that is why I took estradiol would be fine. Oh well, should have read the side effects more closely. Hind sight is always 20/20.  Just curious if anyone else had similar past with the same result.  As all ways, thanks for reading. Missey

Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2011 08:08PM missey29 wrote: Hi ladies! I got home about 4pm. My doctor's office gives out certificates for the last treatment. I forgot to get it. Will pick it up tomorrow for my shot. I'm doing just fine. Tomorrow evening willl start the fatigue. I had a lot of questions for the doctor. Like: Why is the radiation 3 weeks after chemo? because the chemo interferes with the radiation. Why hormone treatment? Because ER/PR + and HER-. THe adrenal glands create estrogen and the meds will counteract that. What is the hormonal therapy i will be taking? First he said Tamoxifen, but I said isn't it for women with ovaries, and he said yes. So I will be taking something starting with an "a", I think it is called arimadex. What are the side effects? hot flashes & bone loss. I will have to take a bone density test to get a baseline. What I can do to counteract these S/Es? Exercise and take 1500 mg of calcium. Eating a balanced diet will help as well. OK to eat soy sauce. Yeah, because I love all types of asian food. I showed him my nails and asked will they fall off. He said no. They will be fine. Finally asked what stage I truly was and if I had clean margins? Also, if/when I am in remission. He said I am a Stage 2 with clean margins. Also, remission started with the lump removal. Glad to get the confirmation re: the stage and the info re: margins and remission. I will make an appointment with the radiology oncologist tomorrow for next week. Then I will find out when and how long I will have for Rads treatment. The way I see it I am half way done. Down with the surgery and chemo and on to radiation and hormone treatments. I really appreciate everyone on this board and I hope everyone is having minimal SE's today. Take care Melissa

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 09:20AM missey29 wrote: Taylor777 - Congrats on your kids and your daughter turning 12. The way I see it there is really no other choice but to be positive. That was my only experience with the Big C. So, when I was diagnosed on 6/14/11 that was my only point of reference. My DH, faith in God and my 11 yr old daughter help me to focus on beating this. Also, knowing that I am not alone helps. Let's be strong together. Keep your head up everyone. Talk to you soon! Missey29

Can't wait to start the radiation treatment. I will definitely look to your information about that. So please keep us posted. Had a question: Do you guys consider yourselves sick? Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2011 01:38PM missey29 wrote: OK. I'm back. My dry run is over. The room is huge and warm. Had to de-robe from the waste up. Glad to be able to keep shoe and socks on. Then I had to lie down face up. Next, clasped my hands above my had and tilted my head up and to the left. It was a weird position to be in. Had the wig off and it felt great. Side note, one of the techs said she thought it was my hair (high fiving Everyone ). There was a machine with arms that moved in from each side but they never touched me. Lights were coming from above and from the side. I have four tats. One in the middle of chest, the other below breast bone, the others are on either side of abdomen. Asked why there was a tat on my left side when the cancer was on the right. The tech said they used it to make sure I was level on the table. Has to be an easier way. Oh well. They took plenty of films and scans. Took about 30 minutes total. I tried to sleep and distract my mind so I would not move. Sometimes I wanted to sneeze, scratch my nose, or move my head but did not move so that the process wouldn't take longer. I know it was all in my head. They marked me up pretty good from the right side of my neck to below my breasts. Thankfully it can wash off. Talk to you guys later! Missey29
